messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: nit: Move this function to this.onThumbnailError_(e). Instead of using this (or self), your're going to use e.target, which should be the image element. Once you have a reference to the image element, you can create and/or find any other elements you want, like topThumbnail and so on.

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/23 22:38:17, pedrosimonetti wrote:
> nit: Move this function to this.onThumbnailError_(e). Instead of using this (or
> self), your're going to use e.target, which should be the image element. Once
> you have a reference to the image element, you can create and/or find any other
> elements you want, like topThumbnail and so on.

We discussed this offline and will revisit later.  It's a little awkward, since it requires giving the image access to dataUrl.

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: nit: Why silver? We should use the same border color as before.

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: Nit: Why Silver? Also, why outline and not border?

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/23 22:38:17, pedrosimonetti wrote:
> nit: Why silver? We should use the same border color as before.

Discussed, and this is the correct color (same as the other borders).

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/23 22:38:17, pedrosimonetti wrote:
> Nit: Why Silver? Also, why outline and not border?

Same as above.  The outline is to prevent the border from taking up space (see the demo).

messages.author: pedrosimonetti2
messages.text: Why are you removing this? Don't we need to override the ntp4 value?
